texts.value: Plays a major role in antagonizing the type I IFN-mediated antiviral response. Acts cooperatively with NS1 to repress activation and nuclear translocation of host IFN-regulatory factor IRF3. Interacts with the host cytoplasmic sensor of viral nucleic acids RIGI and prevents the interaction with its downstream partner MAVS. Together with NS2, participates in the proteasomal degradation of host STAT2, IRF3, IRF7, TBK1 and RIGI through a NS-degradasome involving CUL2 and Elongin-C. The degradasome requires an intact mitochondrial MAVS. Induces host SOCS1 expression. Induces activation of NF-kappa-B. Suppresses premature apoptosis by an NF-kappa-B-dependent, interferon-independent mechanism promoting continued viral replication

Monomer (instable). Homomultimer. Heteromultimer with NS1. Interacts with host RIGI (via N-terminus); this interaction prevents host signaling pathway involved in interferon production. Interacts with host MAP1B/microtubule-associated protein 1B
Most NS2 resides in the mitochondria as a heteromer with NS1
The DNLP motif has IFN suppressive functions like binding to host MAP1B
Belongs to the pneumovirus non-structural protein 2 family

citation.title: Nucleotide and predicted amino acid sequence analysis of the ovine respiratory syncytial virus non-structural 1C and 1B genes and the small hydrophobic protein gene.
